top_insights: Switching rate is critical: 159.8 switches/hour on average (normal 20-40) with a 344/hr peak — 4-8x sustainable levels.
Focus is highly fragmented: average session 1.8 minutes; 48.6% of sessions are <0.9 minutes (micro-switching).
High context load: 83 unique windows in 3.52 hours indicates heavy multi-app juggling and attention residue.
Work is scattered across an 8-hour span with some early-morning activity (10.3%) and no evening work — low total time but prolonged availability window.
Recent activity shows ping-ponging between ~2 windows (2.1 unique) yet 86 switches in 15 minutes — compulsive toggling rather than progress.

flags.message: Average switching rate 159.8/hr (critical) and peak 344/hr are unsustainable and will rapidly deplete attentional resources.
flags.prescription: Turn on Do Not Disturb and keep only one work window open for the next 25 minutes.

flags.message: Average session length is 1.8 minutes, with 48.6% of sessions under 0.9 minutes — consistent with constant micro-switching and no consolidation of attention.
flags.prescription: Work in 25/5 cycles for the next 2 hours (four 25-minute focus blocks with 5-minute breaks).

flags.message: 83 unique windows in 3.52 hours indicates excessive context breadth and attention residue.
flags.prescription: Before your next task, cap open windows to 5 total and save everything else to a 'Later' list.

flags.message: Recent 15-minute interval had 86 switches while averaging ~2 unique windows — rapid back-and-forth ('alt-tab ping-pong') rather than steady progress.
flags.prescription: Place the two active apps side-by-side in split-screen and stop alt-tabbing for the next 60 minutes.

flags.message: Active across 8 hours but only 3.52 hours logged — scattered bursts increase start-up costs and perceived always-on load.
flags.prescription: Choose a 6-hour work window today (e.g., 9–3) and do not work outside that window.

flags.message: No evening work (good), but 10.3% early-morning activity can impair recovery if it shortens sleep.
flags.prescription: Only work before 7 AM on nights when you achieved at least 7 hours of sleep; otherwise shift early tasks to mid-morning.

flags.message: Total logged time is 3.52 hours — load is not excessive, but intensity is very high.
flags.prescription: Prioritize intensity reduction over hours: schedule one 60–90 minute deep block tomorrow morning as your sole high-focus session.
